intro: Cerastium biflorum, commonly known as the two-flowered mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters, typically in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, velvety texture. Cerastium biflorum thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
